like a bass simply by singing in Matan
is to allow for musical amateurs and
beginners to have a way to get ideas
that they have out of their head without
needing the dexterity to play sounds

impressive
the magic of Emmitt owned is that it
works by using a microphone as a MIDI
input an especially engineered algorithm
identifies the pitch at super speed and
assigns a note to your voice when run
alongside music software such as
GarageBand logic or Ableton this note
can be played out as any digital
instrument with no latency that means
you can get almost immediate feedback
whilst you perform I see it as something
that could be a tool for learning and
just sort of raw creativity there's
still a few things to iron out in this
alpha version namely how to tweak the
settings to deal with screaming death
metal singers and percussion sounds
which are harder for machines to pitch
but it's easy to get carried away
